alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 3:04PM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 9 and 16 inches through Monday across Lookout Pass. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Additional snow accumulations between 10 and 20 inches possible at Lookout Pass, lighter amounts in the valleys. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Lookout Pass through Monday afternoon, then including Pinehurst, Wallace, Kellogg, Osburn, Fourth Of July Pass, Dobson Pass, Fernwood, St. Maries, and Mullan. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Sunday to 4 PM PST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
